reviewText: I bought it for The Case of the Hillside Stranglers. It was alright. The Taking of Pelham 123? How many remakes does that require?

I really like both of these movies, it came on time, in fact it came a day early. However when I open the package and look at the dvd they were blue on the back, which meant they are boot leg dvd's. I was indeed shock to say the lease. I then proceeded to play them, they played ok, the picture  was clear on both dvd's and the sound was also ok. This is the only reason why I decided to keep them, other wise I would have return them. This dvd was sold by amazon.com and since I am a new customer to amazon I am not sure what to do now as far as future purchases from amazon. I have 773 dvd movies and all of them are the original and came factory sealed. This is certainly a wake up call for me I would like to continue to be a customer of amazon.com and hope this will not happen again. This is why I only gave it 3 stars, other wise I would have given it 5 stars.
both great clasic movies to watch
Two good movies, quality of picture and sound is good.  Remake of ToP123 is not bad at all, and I loved the original.

video and sound are ok

123 is one of 3 versions, and this version is a bit different with one of hijackers being a woman for example. Robert Shaw was IMHO the best mastermind in first 123.

hillside stranglers is pretty good with good actors especially the cousins.
Billy Zane can do wonders with his facial expressions and they are all represented here as a  serial killer  He should capitalize on this technique of his.

This dvd was all I could hope for.  To get both movies was great.
The picture quality is a 9 of 10.
